item.title: III. THE PINDAPITRIYAGÑA OBLATION OF OBSEQUIAL CAKES TO THE FATHERS.
item.description: 01 Now the living beings once approached Prajāpati–beings doubtless mean creatures–and said, ‘Ordain unto us in what manner we are to live!’ Thereupon the gods, being properly invested with the sacrificial cord 1 and bending the right knee, approached him. To them he said, ‘The sacrifice (shall be) your food; immortality your sap; and the sun your light!’ 02 Then the fathers approached, wearing the cord on the right shoulder, and bending the left knee.

item.title: IV. THE ÂGRAYANESHTI OFFERING OF FIRST-FRUITS.
item.description: 01 Now Kahoḍa Kaushītaki spake, ‘This sap (of the plants) truly belongs to those two, heaven and earth: having offered of this sap to the gods, we will eat it.’ ‘That is why the offering of first-fruits is performed.’ 02 And Yājñavalkya also spake:–The gods and the Asuras, both of them sprung from Prajāpati, once contended for superiority. The Asuras then defiled, partly by magic, partly with poison, both kinds of plants–those on which men and beasts subsist–hoping that in this way they might over come the gods.

item.title: THE DÂKSHÂYANA SACRIFICE.
item.description: Here also two days were, as a rule, required for the performance, both at full and new moon; but while, at the ordinary sacrifice, At full moon some authorities add a special ishṭi to Indra Vimr̥dh (’the Averter of evil’). The new-moon performance concludes with libations of whey to the divine coursers (the horses of the gods); and, optionally, with an ishṭi to Āditya. The performance of the Dākshāyaṇa sacrifice was held to be obligatory only for a period of fifteen years (see XI, 1, 2, 13), whereas the ordinary new and full-moon offerings had to be performed for double that period from the setting up of the sacred fires.

III, 37), ‘Earth! ether! sky!’ In saying ‘Earth! ether! sky!’ he renders his speech auspicious by means of the truth, and with that (speech) thus rendered propitious he invokes a blessing:–‘May I be well supplied with offspring!’ whereby he prays for offspring; ‘–well supplied with men!’ whereby he prays for men (heroes); ‘–well supplied with viands!
